intro: Leptochilus varians, commonly known as the variable featherfoil, is a flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Leptochilus varians is often found in open, sunny areas and is valued for its ornamental foliage.
